title: Liverpool provide Joel Matip and Xherdan Shaqiri injury updates ahead of Arsenal clash
text:

Liverpool have revealed the latest injury news concerning Joel Matip and Xherdan Shaqiri.

Matip has missed the last two games - wins against Genk and Tottenham - due to a knee problem which has been plaguing the 28-year-old since the defeat of Sheffield United at the end of September.

Liverpool’s medical staff are refusing to put a timeframe on his return but are pessimistic about his hopes of a quick return.

Shaqiri, also 28, has been absent for a month due to a calf injury and is unlikely to be back in action until late November.

Liverpool assistant manager Pepijn Lijnders said: “Shaq will only be back after the international break.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

“We want to give him the time. With a calf injury it is always very high risk, especially with his calves.

“Joel’s knee is still irritated – we need to give him time. I don’t know the exact time he will need but it will really need time to heal.”

Lijnders also moved to ease fears about Mohamed Salah’s availability for tomorrow’s Carabao Cup clash against Arsenal.

Salah limped off in the final stages of Sunday’s win against Tottenham due to ongoing soreness in his ankle, but he took part in training on Monday and has been given the all-clear to play.

(Image: Getty Images)

“Mo is fine,” said Lijnders.

“Towards the end of the game it is more precaution because the ankle gets more tired and he feels it a little bit more and we have to take him off. But he is fine, he is good.

“All the others are fit, hungry and ready to go.”
description: Mohamed Salah's availability for Arsenal Carabao Cup clash also discussed by Jurgen Klopp's assistant Pepijn Lijnders
